messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Pet Lobsters?
messages.messageBody:
>>this place sells pet lobsters. They ship even.

http://www.petsolutions.com/Lobsters-C-40001669-C-.aspx<<

Great website! I think the tank has to be salt water to have lobsters.
They sure are cool.

I'll also look into the crawdad suggestion.

Thanks!
Sunday

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Pet Lobsters?
messages.msgSnippet: How about crawdads? Sherry Sunday Cote  wrote: Okay, you creative Unschoolers.do you have any thoughts on this. My 5 year old has developed
messages.messageBody:
How about crawdads?
Sherry

Sunday Cote <sundaycote@...> wrote:
Okay, you creative Unschoolers.do you have any thoughts on this.

My 5 year old has developed a fascination with fish and we've been busy
following that passion by setting up our own aquarium. Recently, he has
decided that he wants to own a lobster. So far our research hasn't come
up with any way to do this - although I did find a great video on
YouTube of someone feeding their pet lobster. I tried to engage the guy
at the pet store about it, but I don't think he took my son's
fascination with crustaceans seriously. He just said, "No, you can't
own lobsters. It's illegal." When I tried to pursue other options that
might satisfy my son, he had no ideas.

So, any thoughts about other crustaceans that might be fun to have? We
already have a couple of ghost shrimp which have been fascinating but
he'd like something bigger and easier to find in the tank. :-) Other
types of shrimp maybe?

Thanks for your thoughts,
Sunday

messages.subject: Pet Lobsters?
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, you creative Unschoolers.do you have any thoughts on this. My 5 year old has developed a fascination with fish and we ve been busy following that passion
messages.messageBody:
Okay, you creative Unschoolers.do you have any thoughts on this.

My 5 year old has developed a fascination with fish and we've been busy
following that passion by setting up our own aquarium. Recently, he has
decided that he wants to own a lobster. So far our research hasn't come
up with any way to do this - although I did find a great video on
YouTube of someone feeding their pet lobster. I tried to engage the guy
at the pet store about it, but I don't think he took my son's
fascination with crustaceans seriously. He just said, "No, you can't
own lobsters. It's illegal." When I tried to pursue other options that
might satisfy my son, he had no ideas.

So, any thoughts about other crustaceans that might be fun to have? We
already have a couple of ghost shrimp which have been fascinating but
he'd like something bigger and easier to find in the tank. :-) Other
types of shrimp maybe?

Thanks for your thoughts,
Sunday
